a.g: By the night when it covers
And [by] the day when it appears
And [by] He who created the male and female,
Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
As for he who gives and fears Allah
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإذا دامت التقوى وقوى التصديق بما في العاقبة من الحسنى تيسر الصبر ولذلك قال تعالى: ﴿ فأما من أعطى واتقى وصدق بالحسنى فسنيسره لليسرى ﴾ ومثال هذه القسمة قدرة المصارع على غيره فإن الرجل القوي يقدر على أن يصرع الضعيف بأدنى حملة وأيسر قوة بحيث لا يلقاه في مصارعته إعياء ولا لغوب ولا تضطرب فيه نفسه ولا ينبهر ولا يقوى على أن يصرع الشديد إلا بتعب ومزيد جهد وعرق جبين فهكذا تكون المصارعة بين باعث الدين وباعث الهوى فإنه على التحقيق صراع بين جنود الملائكة وجنود الشياطين ومهما أذعنت الشهوات وانقمعت وتسلط باعث الدين واستولى وتيسر الصبر بطول المواظبة اورث ذلك مقام الرضا كما سياتي في كتاب الرضا فالرضا أعلى من الصبر.
Indeed, when God-consciousness [taqwa] endures and conviction [tasdiq] in the ultimate good [al-husna] in the Hereafter strengthens, patience [sabr] is made easy. And for this reason, the Most High said: "As for he who gives and is God-conscious [ittaqa] and affirms the ultimate good [al-husna], We will ease his way to ease." And the example of this division is the wrestler's power over another. For the strong man is able to overpower the weak with the slightest charge and easiest exertion, such that he meets no fatigue [i'ya'] or weariness [lughub] in wrestling him, nor is his self [nafs] disturbed, nor is he bewildered, whereas he cannot overpower the strong except with toil, increased effort, and sweat upon the brow. Thus is the wrestling between the motivator of religion [din] and the motivator of base desire [hawa], for it is, in truth, a wrestling between the soldiers of the angels and the soldiers of the devils. Whenever the appetites [shahawat] submit and are subdued, and the motivator of religion [din] gains mastery and takes control, and patience [sabr] is made easy through constant perseverance, that bequeaths the station [maqam] of contentment [rida], as will come in the Book of Contentment. For contentment [rida] is higher than patience [sabr].

a.g: And believes in the best [reward],
We will ease him toward ease.

w.e: and considers himself free from need

a.g: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
And denies the best [reward],
We will ease him toward difficulty.
And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?
Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأراد به العلم وقال تعالى إن علينا للهدى
Indeed, upon Us is the guidance [al-huda].

a.g: And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ﴿ فأنذرتكم نارا تلظى لا يصلاها إلا الأشقى الذي كذب وتولى ﴾{} وأخبر تعالى أن النار أعدها لإعدائه وإنما خوف بها أولياءه فقال: ﴿ لهم من فوقهم ظلل من النار ومن تحتهم ظلل ذلك يخوف الله به عباده ﴾{} وقال تعالى: ﴿ واتقوا النار التي أعدت للكافرين ﴾{}
Indeed, I have warned you of a Fire [nar] that blazes fiercely. None shall enter it except the most wretched [al-ashqa], who denied [kadhdhaba] and turned away [tawalla]. And the Most High has informed that He prepared the Fire for His enemies, and He only frightens His allies with it. He said: "For them, above them are layers of the Fire, and beneath them are layers. Thus does Allah frighten His servants with it." And the Most High said: "And fear the Fire which has been prepared for the disbelievers [al-kafirin]."

a.g: None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one.
Who had denied and turned away.

w.e: But will be removed from it

a.g: But the righteous one will avoid it -
[He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself
And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded
But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, Most High.
And he is going to be satisfied.
